Reviews.Title: Needs a sound boost
Reviews.Author: stephie
Reviews.Content: I needed to replace my old 19" CRT TV (yes really) because my cable company got rid of all analog channels and I hated having to turn on devices just to check the weather.I couldn't find any reviews anywhere on this TV and it's one of the few brands I recognized. My HDD's are Phillips and they're awesome so I had hoped this TV would be too. This Phillips was meant to be the one I watched the most but 22" was too small for that (bought a 26" Vizio for that purpose) so it's been put to use in another room instead.I use this TV daily and coming from a CRT, WOW, there's a major difference in the picture. All the 1080 channels are just beautiful with crisp clear colors. Sound-wise though it could use a boost. I suggest adding external speakers to this unit because the speakers are in the back and aim upwards, so if you have it in a TV cabinet like I do, the sound will be too low in your average sized room.The remote and settings are intuitive and easy to use. The TV was easy to connect, lots of cable options (component, HDMI, etc.). I can say that even though I didn't need or want to replace my old TV I do not miss it. Even with wide screen everything, which for me, takes some getting used to, I'm liking this.I wish there were more reviews but I got a great price and so far am happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: Jay Tee
Reviews.Content: I had this TV unpacked, assembled, hooked up and working in less that 30 minutes. It went into a channel search automatically when turned on for the first time. The channel search required about half of the 30 minutes needed to get it going.I think the TV has a great picture and sound for a TV of this size and price. It was easy to assemble the stand with two screws and the channel setup was automatic after attaching the cable and plugging it in. After that you go thru a very easy procedure to adjust the picture settings to your requirements. That was it, nothing else required to make it operational and it's been working great since. Correction, you do need to insert the batteries into the remote and turn the TV on before the channel setup will start.There is one thing you need to know. The 22 inch model has only one HDMI connection, not three as stated on the web site. It appears you must buy the 26 inch model if you need more than one HDMI. I have no need for the one that it does have so I'm not down-rating the TV for this web site error.

Reviews.Title: 1 minor hiccup
Reviews.Author: N. Bolerjack
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my wife in the bedroom and it is perfect for that application. Its beautiful and bright. My only complaint is that in the "technical details" it claims to have 3 HDMI ports, but in fact it only has one. I was really disappointed to discover this upon arrival because that was a selling feature for me. According to the paperwork, the 26" and up versions have the 3 HDMI.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: M. Turner
Reviews.Content: I was looking to replace the tv in my daughter's bedroom. She is only 3 years old. I am familiar with the Philips brand because we already owned a  32" and a 60". I thought it was best to stick with what I knew. When this arrived I was pleased and surprised. The tv has touch sensors on it instead of buttons. Sound quality is good and it is even slimer than the other tvs in the house. I don't think there is anything to complain about.

Reviews.Title: Great Bedroom TV...would be an excellent Dorm Room TV!
Reviews.Author: Brian Miller "Do As Much Good as You Can...As...
Reviews.Content: Set up was a breeze...replaced an older tube TV in the bedroom with this.Color is excellent and it is very very energy efficient.  $4 a year running 6 hours a day, which is way more than I'll run.Reason I bought was that it was 1080 instead of the 720 generally available in this price range.UPDATEHave had this TV for several months now.  It continues to amaze me with the color and clarity.  Sound could be better, but generally speaking not watching big movies with this.  Did have the opportunity to catch the Monday night football game on this and was great.  Recommend this for anyone looking for a quality, fairly priced system

Reviews.Title: Decent TV at a good price - Not recommended to hang on wall
Reviews.Author: CB
Reviews.Content: I hung this TV on the wall of my exercise room.  So far the picture is great.  The speakers of the TV are pointed down and it seems since it is hanging on the wall the sound has nothing to bounce off of so it is very quiet.  I have to turn the volume up very high to get decent level.  If i put my hand under the speaker it seems to get louder.  So I would not recommend this TV if you are hanging it on a wall.  Also the TV only has 1 HDMI port (the description when I bought it said 2).

Reviews.Title: Great bedroom TV
Reviews.Author: Robert K. Mertz
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to go in my bedroom and connect to a Roku XD|S and I have to say it works great.  The picture is great, sound isn't what you'd expect from a stereo but it is quite good for TV speakers, the remote and menus are easy to use and understand, and the TV isn't heavy and quite thin.  For the price and size you can't find a much better TV.  (Note: I can't comment on the tuner function as I'm not using that but I don't see any reason why that would be a problem)I do want to add that when I first hooked this up I did have some frustrating issues with it constantly saying my Roku player was giving it a resolution that it could not support.  I was using the same HDMI cable that I was using to connect my Roku to a HANNSpree monitor which was working fine.  I also noticed that when I power cycled my Roku the TV would display the startup screen but once the menu loaded it gave me either the resolution error or a blue screen.  I tried adjusting every setting possible and was really close to giving up.  As a last ditch effort (and fullt convinced that it wasn;t going to help) I used another HDMI cable to go from the Roku to the new TV and amazingly that solved the problem.  It still kind of confuses me as to why the old HDMI cable worked fine going from my Roku to the HANNSpree but not to this Phillips TV but I don't see any way that this is the fault of the TV.  The old HDMI cable was a lighter weight and the only thing that I can assume is that since I am using conduit for the power and HDMI cable and the monitor had a thicker power cable than this TV does there is more interference in the conduit that affected the lighter weight HDMI cable.  Again, none of this is the fault of the TV but I wanted to add it in case anyone else ran into similar issues with this or another TV.  If you're having issues make sure you are using a heavy weight HDMI cable (you don't need to buy an expensive one, just one that has good insulation) and if you are running your HDMI cable and power cable in the same conduit try taking it out of the conduit just to verify before you blame the TV.Overall this is a great little TV for a bedroom and if you're looking for something in this size you'll be more than satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Ideal Kitchen TV
Reviews.Author: Brassbass "Gardensmith"
Reviews.Content: The Phillips 22 inch TV is ideal for our galley kitchen. The image is sharp and clear. The sound is very good and the color is excellent. It was easy to set up and user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Sharp Picture, Mediocre Sound
Reviews.Author: Matthew Mccabe
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as a monitor for the kids' computer.  It seems fairly sturdy, and the picture is nice and sharp.  When it didn't display all of the desktop for the computer, one of the kids' friends figured out that the TV itself has settings that took care of that.  Very versitile for a basic TV.  The sound is somewhat lacking - it is clear, but with not much in the way of bass.  I guess that is what you would expect from a TV.  Overall, I am happy with this TV, both for its brief use as a television (picked up channels quickly and clearly), and for its day to day use as a computer monitor.

Reviews.Title: A great TV, but I'd go for a bigger screen
Reviews.Author: Jeff Wignall "Photographer, Author and Radio ...
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace a tiny 15" CRT TV in the bedroom and it's a fine TV. In fact, I have to say that everything I've ever bought with the Philips and Magnavox name on it has performed flawlessly--and that goes back probably 20 years. I have not one single complaint in all those years. This TV has very good color fidelity and very good sound. My only issue is that the 22" screen is a bit smaller than I was thinking (I bought it online without looking at one in a store--I hate store shopping) and so when I watch a letterbox dvd, it's smaller yet. Still, I think everything about this TV from set-up to image quality is super and I particularly like that it integrates so seamlessly with my Philps dvd player.The bottom line is that for under $200 (pretty far under $200 if you have Prime and don't have to pay shipping) this is a really good TV for a small bedroom. I've since replaced it with a larger TV (a 40" Philips) but I'm thinking of putting this one in the kitchen to watch news while cooking.

Reviews.Title: So good I am buying a second
Reviews.Author: Edward Hayes "mrfish"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a TV to up grade to, so I could watch my blue-ray DVD movies and Roku device on in high def. I was talking with one my tech savvy friends, he told me about Philips brand and why he thinks they are the best TV for the price. I have looked around and found that for the money I have to invest, less than 200 dollars, this size and picture quality with all its extra features is the best I have found.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV for the price
Reviews.Author: epenn28
Reviews.Content: I'm a college student who was looking for a TV to put in my dorm room that didn't need to be large or expensive, so after a little research I was drawn to this TV. Now, Philips isn't Samsung or Toshiba, but they have quality products, and I decided to go for it. The TV has good quality and isn't too large or heavy (it shouldn't be, it's a 22-inch after all) and was a perfect fit for my dorm room without being excessive or a pain to move around. Something I found pretty neat was the touch controls on front, which are nice and responsive, while the remote is fairly simple and easy to use as well. The sound is definitely adequate in small, quiet environments but in medium or large rooms it is somewhat lacking, as the speakers face upwards and slightly away from the viewer.Connections: The biggest problem with this TV is the lack of HDMI-supported PC connection. This TV is currently a secondary monitor for my laptop and works just fine, but it only connects with a VGA cable despite having an HDMI connection. This only works for auxiliary devices but I haven't had a problem with it so far. My Gamecube is also connected to it and works perfectly, but there aren't enough video/audio ports for anything else to connect. However, it does have a USB port for cameras and the such for slideshows, although I haven't used that yet. Also, it has a standard audio out jack in case you need to plug in headphones or external speakers (my computer speakers worked perfectly to watch the Super Bowl with awesome sound).If you're looking for a pretty good quality HDTV for a good price, then I would recommend it for sure. If you need one with PC connectivity via HDMI, then it might not be the best for you, but a VGA cable still works. All in all, a good TV.Edit: Well, here's to not testing things out and writing reviews on them. Turns out this TV does support HDMI connectivity with a computer, I just assumed it didn't because the description never explicitly stated so. It works just fine with my Dell Latitude XT3 and my friend's Fujitsu (some kind of lifebook convertible) so I assume it will work with the majority of them out there. I would recommend this even more than before now that I know this!

Reviews.Title: Awesome little TV.
Reviews.Author: Joshuak
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV to replace the old school CRT TV that I had in my bedroom. It has a nice picture and despite some user reviews. the sound can be quite loud and it is good sound for such a small TV. It doesn't thump when bass is up but it's for the bedroom, so it doesn't need to.

Reviews.Title: There's one HDMI port, not three
Reviews.Author: Evan
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great. The viewing angle isn't. I would place the TV at, or near, eye level. Otherwise the color on the screen looks distorted.There's only 1 HDMI port. The specifications on this page say there are 3 HDMI ports. I'm not happy about that.

Reviews.Title: good tv, bad support!
Reviews.Author: Cody Ryan Belcher
Reviews.Content: Bought this tv for use while im in Afghanistan on down time with the soldiers, I have had it for about 3 months and the picture quality is great for the size, it does however only come with one HDMI port....I have zero complaints about the picture and the craftsmanship of the actual tv itself....but the little plastic stand is horrible...I don't understand why they would make such a good product only to finish it off with a cheap plastic stand held by two tiny little screws! I wanted to give this 5 stars because I am reviewing the TV afterall but the stand just doesn't cut it, and if it breaks over here then we go back to nothing! Id look else where if u cant afford for it to break!

Reviews.Title: Nice dorm TV.
Reviews.Author: Kevin Slater
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for my daughter to use in her dorm. Her roommate's 19" is just a bit too small. This has a nice picture and plenty of inputs and won't take up much more space than the existing one.

Reviews.Title: Continue to be impressed with Philips
Reviews.Author: djk1940 "Don"
Reviews.Content: Actually this is my 4th Philips LCD TV TV; all are still working when I've had failures with HDTVs by Toshiba, Samsung, Magnavox, and ViewSonic. My original attraction to the brand was their reasonable price combined with quality pictures and sound, and they seem to continue to meet that standard.  On this model, I particularly like having touch controls on the front of the TV (convenient), the LED back lighting (longer life), a digital sound output (I attached it to  Logitech Z-5500 THX-Certified 5.1 Digital Surround Sound Speaker System), and the thin design with a small frame (less blocked visual space).  As another reviewer pointed out, this 22 inch model only has 1 HDMI input (Amazon, you should correct your ad, which says 3!!), but that was all that I needed, using it to provide an extra monitor for my computer. I'm  getting my HD TV inputs through the component connections from a TiVo 50 feet away, using a pair of baluns and cat 5 cable, which work great with this TV...this connection did not work with the previous Toshiba 24L4200U 24-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED TV (Black) I tried, and had to send it back to Amazon.  The fact this TV only offers 720p screen resolution is not a problem for me; even at the only 3 ft distance that I watch the TV, it is nearly impossible to distinguish it from 1080p on a 22 inch screen.  In addition, analog channels that I created for a 2nd TiVo and Roku, using an old video distribution system, are very clear and noise free, which may also be of interest to those that still get analog channels over cable. After a month of use, I couldn't be happier.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Television
Reviews.Author: LJ
Reviews.Content: I love this television. After searching for many hours through endless reviews on these smaller led/lcd televisions I decided this would be the best one to get. Sure it's only 22 inches and 720p resolution, but honestly you don't need a 1080p if you are looking into these smaller sizes. Plus almost every television channel broadcast only 720p. As for the speakers, it would have been nice to have them in front instead of the rear. Still, I have no problems with hearing the sound even when I turn it below a fourth of the max audio level. After tweaking a little with the picture settings, I got a awesome vibrant picture. It's a brand name television at a bargain price; you can't go wrong. Just don't expect to put it in your living room, this one is for the bedroom or the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after 10months, Galactics will not fix or replace
Reviews.Author: Meghan O. Monaco
Reviews.Content: TV was purchased for guest bedroom. It was used a few times a month. One evening TV was & it just blacked out, & wouldn't turn back on. I contacted the seller and they would not stand behind the product that they sold me. They told me to contact the manufacturer... I do not recommended this TV (also it was not as vibrant as the ad), and I do not recommended purchasing from Galactics. Also, they shipped it to me in the actual TV box, which I thought was strange. There was no damage to the box, but it was not packed inside another box- this is a $200 TV, you'd think they would pack their product with precaution. Now I'm stuck with a $200 nothing.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: P. Webster "webbie"
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my parents and they absolutely love it. It takes up very little space in their kitchen and it has a beautiful picture.

Reviews.Title: Some concern
Reviews.Author: Amunique
Reviews.Content: I have always purchased Phillips TV's.  This is my first flat screen.  I a very disappointed in the color quality.  I have adjusted  and re- adjusted the color and it still isn't as sharp as my 20+ year old (tube) Phillips.

Reviews.Title: Nice display!
Reviews.Author: Alex Sadowski
Reviews.Content: Very minimal but very nice.  Backlight is perfect for this set and the touch sensitive controls are a bonus.  Remote is too big and not laid out properly though.

Reviews.Title: Good purchase
Reviews.Author: D. Wilson
Reviews.Content: Happy with this tv. Great for my bedroon. Was concerned it may be too small for my bedroom but turned out perfect. Very clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Does not last
Reviews.Author: Michael J. Christie
Reviews.Content: I bought this 22" TV: Phillips 22PFL4507, on July 25, 2012. It had a catastrophic failure on April 15, 2013, 9 months after purchase. By catastrophic, I mean that it totally died without any warning, no lights came on, etc. Called Phillips and they sent out a new one under my 1 year warranty. I sent the defective one back. The replacement worked from late April until November 23rd, 2013, when it died exactly the same way. There weren't any warnings, it just was dead upon turning on. I had and used it for 7 months, only to find out that the replacement unit only had a 3 month warranty and Phillips refused to do anything about it. Stay away from this Company and TV folks!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Set for a Minor Price
Reviews.Author: Emmitt
Reviews.Content: Good sound and good product for the price. Teamed with inexpensive DVR  and fits nicely  together. Would not use as the primary house set

Reviews.Title: Nice product
Reviews.Author: AlleyCat
Reviews.Content: This TV is a fine value and very flexible with multiple input options. It works well as a TV, or as an extended desktop display monitor. Ideal for a small space needing multiple uses.

Reviews.Title: The Philips 22PFFL4507 is a good overall TV within its price range
Reviews.Author: Raithskar
Reviews.Content: I've owned and used this 22" unit as a "bedroom" TV/monitor for about 1.5 years now.  It is still working fine today, after quite extensive daily usage.I was originally looking for a 20-22" TV LED/LCD TV that could pull double-duty as both TV and computer monitor, and this was one of the few sets that I could find that still had a native headphone jack on the TV set (for viewing cable TV at a 8-12" distance with wired headphones).  I never purchased a Philips product before, but decided to give it a try, and it has been a positive experience thus far.Not much to say about "TV Mode" really.  It works with cable TV in all the ways that it is supposed to work, and looks perfectly fine by 720p viewing standards - though you will need to play around with the various settings a bit to find the view setting that are best for you personally.I hooked this TV set up to my desktop computer via a DVI-D to HDMI cable, and had some problems at first.  My computer would not boot without my old "screen dead" LCD monitor still hooked up to my other DVI port (turned off or on).  This problem went away when I changed some settings in my desktop system BIOS, including disabling "Windows 8 Secure Boot" (which you would also have to disable to install Windows 7 on this system).  I'm not sure why this was a problem in the first place, but it shouldn't have been.  I was told by someone that if I also connect my secondary desktop DVI-I port to my VGA connector on my TV (in addition to my current DVI-D to HDMI hookup), that the computer would boot properly in "Windows 8 Secure Mode" with the TV, but I never tried that method yet.As a 720p computer monitor, this TV is perfectly fine if you don't mind using it mostly in its native 1366 x 768 resolution mode - since that is easily the "cleanest resolution mode" for viewing text without using windows to artificially magnify certain text.  Any other resolution that I use with this TV/Monitor is hard on my eyes, so I stick with 1366 x 768.  Even in games, higher resolutions like 1440 x 900, 1600 x 900, or 1920 x 1080 will make any display text more of a headache to look at, so keep that in mind.  On the bright side, even a current entry-level Geforce GTX 750 1GB video card can easily play any game at maximum-quality settings at 1366 x 768 resolution (or 1600 x 900 for that matter), with very high frame-rates. :)As a side note, you will have to set the contrast, brightness and viewing setting a bit different in "computer monitor mode" versus "normal TV viewing mode".  Once done, it will switch to those settings whenever you switch from TV to HDMI/Monitor mode.My only real complaints about this TV/Monitor thus far:(A) It has no tilt or swivel feature, so it limits your viewing aesthetics in that regard.(B) The native TV speakers, like in most TVs today, are quite weak and underwhelming, so you will have to hook it up to a stronger speaker/stereo system (or headphones) to maximize your listening pleasure.(C) The TV base feels sort of cheap/lightweight, and I'm not of fan of the glossy black plastic finish on the whole set overall.  A flat black matte finish would have been much nicer on this set.I hope that you found this review helpful.

Reviews.Title: If I could give it a zero star, I would.
Reviews.Author: Mjett
Reviews.Content: Tv just quit working. Bought this tv for a bathroom. Never took it down or moved it. It lasted 1 year and 3 days. I've read on several other sites that there has been similar problems where it just quits working. Very disappointed in this tv. Probably won't ever buy another Philips product again.

Reviews.Title: i liked it.
Reviews.Author: anthony carter
Reviews.Content: good condition.the item was packaged properly.my daughter likes it.haven't had any problems yet.i don't think it was 22inches though.more like 20 inches.

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: heygable
Reviews.Content: Im looking for a Philips in a larger size.  This tv is great.  The sound is good, picture is great and the best part.... If you lose the remote, there are touch controls on the bottom. Im enjoying every minute of it!

Reviews.Title: Too poor to be a a philips........
Reviews.Author: Hector Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: I am really disappointed ....I bought this tv after hours of reading reviews and lots of Walmart visits, unfortunately I didn't see any philips tv in display so I bought it just like that. I have to confess that I'm not a expert so what I was looking for was a led tv with the best image definition in 22 or 24 inches and here is where I got disappointed the image quality is realy poor compare whit the Japanese branches Samsung LG etc. So I have a 22 in. tv whit a plasma quality

Reviews.Title: esperando
Reviews.Author: Cesar augusto Borges valero
Reviews.Content: Hello I apologize for placing 3 star but for now I can not give you more stars because a non e received produccto in Venezuela once I get my hands on the product and if it is like your you describe I promise up the punctuation 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Perfect Visual, Crap Sound
Reviews.Author: Travis L. Corpin "ArchitectOfRevolution"
Reviews.Content: Got this for a travel gaming tv and monitor for my laptop. LED is spectacular, the price was super cheap. Sound is crap though. I mean no bass, no mid, all treble. Make sure you have some other kind of sound to plug into this beast, because if you don't, it will be heartbreakingly disappointing (something that clear to look at needs to sound clear too).Touch controls on the bottom of the TV was nice too…stylish and modern.Had it for a while now, traveled with it quite a bit. Seems to hold up ok, no problems with the cords, the remote, or screen. Sound is still crap though. Hope this helps!!

Reviews.Title: the tv arrived damaged
Reviews.Author: Luis J.
Reviews.Content: when turning on the tv detects a purple or blue streak obscures fine image. not that we do in this case because, I am in Venezuela and the first time this happens I

Reviews.Title: As described
Reviews.Author: CLM
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my parents for their anniversary. Prime shipping, so it got there in 2 days. They are using it as a kitchen TV. My mom said it was packaged really safely and the set up was easy. She says it looks and sounds great. If they're happy, I'm happy!

Reviews.Title: phillips 22' tv
Reviews.Author: DENNIS PERRY
Reviews.Content: delivered on time ,easy to install ,great picture. if it last i might go for a 42' set. so far so good.

Reviews.Title: FIRST IMPRESSION
Reviews.Author: Thomas Howard Magnuson
Reviews.Content: I bought the set for use in the bedroom. I only use the bedroom tv for late night talk shows and morning news. After installing the base w/2 screws, and plugging in the power and house antenna feed I prepared myself mentally for the expected long gruesome "initial set-up". Imagine my surprise when the entire process --- Channel Search, picture and sound preferences --- TOOK LESS THAN THREE MINUTES!!! My initial reaction is that this is a perfect set for use in a bedroom or kitchen, or for use on a desktop as a combination TV and computer monitor. If, after using the set for awhile, I have anything to add I'll post it here.  THM  Northern California

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: lovecats4 "sac68"
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with the purchase of this television.  I like the quality of picture and the quality of sound better than my other 22" Samsung tv.Also, in this tv's favor, soon after I bought it, my frisky cat actually jumped onto the television, crashing it to the floor.  Surprise, surprise - it still worked just fine when I set it back up.I recommend this television for anyone wanting to buy a 22 " tv

Reviews.Title: Good if you don't mind missing pieces
Reviews.Author: KAE
Reviews.Content: The TV itself is great and works fine.  Packaging was pretty beat up and there was no remote control to be found.  That was the disappointment with the purchase, not everything in the box...so changing the channel is a hassle.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied customer
Reviews.Author: Shel20284
Reviews.Content: Great TV for your bedroom. Cost is right up there in the mix. Excellent purchase for me from warehouse deals

Reviews.Title: Works good.
Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: This TV has replaced an older plasma model we had and so far it has been a pleasure to use. Easy operation and crisp picture.

Reviews.Title: problem with product
Reviews.Author: MARLIN ZAMBRANO
Reviews.Content: Product quality is good, but when I get the package did not have the base of the tv or the remote that corresponds as a brand Hiteker included, need, please, if I can solve the problem, even sending and control I do not get in stores like an original, thanks await your prompt and positive response

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: JOSE ENRIQUE GUERRA SALAZAR
Reviews.Content: The purchase resulted without any problems and just what was described would be sent was received, was tested and liked

Reviews.Title: Delivery problem
Reviews.Author: CLS
Reviews.Content: This was delivered in the original box which had holes and looked very worn.  You could tell the box had been tossed around.  When we opened it the tv seemed okay as it was surrounded with styrofoam.  The tv was the exact size we needed and we set it up per instructions.  Well the tv didn't work, just had some weird color shapes.  We unplugged and reset it up again, still no luck.  The return through Amazon was great, I did tell them the condition it was delivered in was perhaps the reason it wouldn't work.  I would definitely order again but not a tv.

Reviews.Title: Disposable TV.  Spend a bit more and get one that lasts.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Lasted 12 months, then blew the power supply.No user serviceable parts inside, and that includes the fuse.Having had several LCD TVs and monitors from a variety of manufacturers, this has been the shortest lived and by far the most disappointing.  When it worked the picture was ok, the sound anemic but otherwise acceptable for a small set.A single HDMI input is limiting.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: clinton
Reviews.Content: Has grate pic and i use it daily, it is one the better small tv's out there, kinda weak sound though.

Reviews.Title: Wrong Size
Reviews.Author: pumkingirl32
Reviews.Content: We loved the TV but the size dimensions were wrong in the product description. We needed it to fit a specific area and it was way too small. Return was a smooth and we ordered a bigger TV.

Reviews.Title: Terrible HDMI Compatibility. DO NOT BUY
Reviews.Author: Scott Robert Ganz "Casual Adult Gamer (read: ...
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV as an inexpensive monitor for my Playstation 3 while I am working out of town. The TV simply DOES NOT WORK with the PS3's HDMI. Once I encountered the issue, my friend and I separately researched the problem and discovered that this is in fact a common issue encountered with Philips TVs and a host of HDMI devices, including the Apple TV. THE APPLE TV!Philips' support page even lists this as a "Frequently Asked Question", which should tell them something about their horrible product. (Needless to say, the solutions they presented were not, in fact, helpful in the slightest.)This is wholly and completely unacceptable. For Philips to make an HDMI product that cannot interface with numerous popular HDMI devices is quite simply baffling. And yes, the Playstation 3 and Apple TV are incredibly common. This is simply mind-blowing.Do not buy this product. An HDTV that completely and utterly fails to connect with mass-market HDMI devices from top-rated manufacturers is no HDTV at all. It is garbage. It is a waste of resources and time and money and I am diminished and robbed as a human for having dealt with it.Henceforth, I shall consider myself at war with the Philips corporation. That's how bad this is. They have no place in the mass-market electronics industry and the sooner they are purged from the Earth, the better we will all be for it.Go away, Philips. Just go away. Cease to exist. At once. You are bad people who make bad products and if you in fact do make any profit it is clearly obtained by deceiving customers with promises of products you have absolutely no idea how to make.In short, please die.
